business.headline: Nifty hits all-time high after 14 months. What next for domestic markets? A fresh Nifty record has reignited confidence across Dalal Street, lifting traders' moods and shifting market sentiment firmly to the upside. With bulls in control again, is another milestone already on the horizon?

Nifty hits all-time high after 14 months as bull run continues on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex added 224.80 points to 85,836.74, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 60.85 points to 26,266.15 as of 9:25 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will the stock market hit a record high?Sensex, Nifty today: The upbeat mood in global and domestic markets, softer crude oil prices and steady foreign inflows are expected to support the market at the opening bell.

Why relying only on SIPs may hurt your returns in the long runAMFI's October 2025 figures show just how deeply SIPs have entered the Indian investing culture. Monthly SIP contributions touched Rs 29,529.37 crore, the highest ever for the second month in a row and up 16.6% from a year earlier.

Cabinet clears Rs 7,280 crore rare earths scheme amid China's export curbsThe government has cleared a financial outlay of Rs 7,280 crore to set up 6,000 metric tonnes per year of fully integrated REPM manufacturing capacity in India.
Will the new labour codes cut your in-hand salary? Here's the mathNow that the new labour codes are in force and wages are being recalculated, will your monthly take-home salary take a hit?

Not Mumbai, Bengaluru or Pune, this city has seen sharpest rise in home pricesNew data from ANAROCK shows that one city has pulled far ahead of Mumbai, Bengaluru and Pune to record the sharpest rise in home prices across almost every budget segment.

Newly married? Here's the insurance playbook every couple needsBig life changes often bring financial blind spots. For newlyweds, reviewing insurance early is a simple step that keeps their plans on track as they start their new chapter.
Sensex ends 1,000 points up, Nifty above 26,200; RIL gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,022.50 points to close at 85,609.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 320.50 points to end at 26,205.30.
Why are gold and silver prices rising again this week?Prices of gold and silver have moved up once more, with global economic signals and firmer market demand driving this renewed momentum.

Will worsening air quality make your health insurance premium costlier?As pollution worsens across Indian cities, are health insurers preparing to charge residents more for risks they cannot control? The big question now is how soon premiums will change.

PF balance check: How to calculate it without logging inChecking your PF balance no longer requires a portal login. Several quick offline and mobile-based tools now let you check it instantly using just your phone.

The retirement mistake that quietly burns your savingsMany retirees feel safest locking their life savings into fixed deposits. Financial planners warn that this comfort comes at a cost, as inflation and low returns can quietly weaken long-term retirement wealth.

ITR refund delays explained: Tax department shares expected timelineSeveral taxpayers who filed their returns months ago are still waiting for refunds. The tax department has now explained the reasons and shared when refunds are expected.
Bull run on Dalal Street: 5 reasons why Sensex, Nifty jumped todayThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 751.75 points to 85,338.76, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 237.25 points to 26,122.05 by 11:08 am.

How confusing investment tools with goals is costing youIt's easy to fall for traps with exciting returns, lifestyle upgrades, peer pressure or the "this stock is the next big thing" buzz. But life rarely hands you one challenge at a time. School fees, a home loan, a parent's health emergency or an unexpected crisis – they can all come together. Hence, relying on just one tool is like trying to build a house with no foundation – one storm and the whole thing collapses.

Explained: Why Bharti Airtel shares are down 3% todayBharti Airtel share price: Around 3.5 crore shares, equal to nearly 0.6% of Airtel's equity, were traded at Rs 2,108 apiece in the block deal window.
Sensex opens nearly 200 points up, Nifty above 25,900; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 274.90 points to 84,861.91, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 83.25 points to 25,968.05 as of 9:28 am.

Sudeep Pharma IPO allotment today: Step-by-step status check and listing dateThe three-day subscription window, which closed on November 25, saw the IPO race towards nearly 100 times subscription, reflecting strong interest across investor categories.

Excelsoft Technologies IPO listing today: Will the stock open higher or lower?The allotment of shares was completed on November 24, and with the kind of subscription numbers the company has posted, many retail investors are hoping for a firm opening on the exchanges.

entertainment.headline: Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande's Wicked press tour has the internet confused Clips of actors Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo's interactions during the 'Wicked: For Good' press tour have ignited discussion on social media, with users labelling their behaviour as unusually affectionate and prompting mixed reactions.

Aamir Khan bags maiden RK Laxman Award, Boman Irani presents honour. See pics Actor Aamir Khan received the first-ever RK Laxman Award for Excellence. The prestigious award, a special tribute to the legendary artist RK Laxman, was presented by his family to the superstar.

Keerthy Suresh apologises to Chiranjeevi fans for picking Vijay as better dancer Actor Keerthy Suresh addressed Telugu media queries about her statement preferring Vijay as a better dancer over Chiranjeevi and issued an apology to Chiranjeevi's fans ahead of her film release.

Kelly Clarkson's Since U Been Gone song crosses 1 billion Spotify streams Kelly Clarkson's pop-rock anthem 'Since U Been Gone' has become her first song to surpass 1 billion streams on Spotify. It is written and produced by Max Martin and Lukasz "Dr. Luke" Gottwald.

Singer Akriti Kakar blasts crowd chaos after Akon fiasco: Artistes deserve respect Singer Akriti Kakar recently addressed the audience's misbehavior at concerts.  She highlighted incidents involving Karan Aujla, Akon, and Tyga, urging respect for performers.

Bridgerton season 5 may arrive sooner than expected after Netflix update Schedule for Bridgerton's fifth season brings hope for earlier release as production set to begin shortly after season four airs.

Dhanush, Kriti Sanon perform Ganga Aarti in Varanasi ahead of Tere Ishk Mein release Actors Dhanush and Kriti Sanon visited Varanasi, where they performed the Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat as part of their promotional activities for the upcoming film, Tere Ishk Mein. Their presence attracted significant attention from fans, marking a festive atmosphere ahead of the movie's release.

Singer-songwriter Jackson Browne mourns son Ethan Browne, dies at 52 Singer-songwriter Jackson Browne has shared the news of the death of his son Ethan Browne, who was found unresponsive in his home on 25 November 2025. Ethan followed his own creative path as an actor, model, and record label founder.

Dharmendra's prayer meet to be held today, Mumbai to celebrate his life and legacy A prayer meet for veteran actor Dharmendra will be held on November 27 in Mumbai following his death on November 24, with family, friends, and colleagues paying respects.

The Family Man 3 is about a messy, modern Indian family before a spy thriller The Family Man is back with Season 3, and the focus is more on family tension amid espionage thrills. The new season explores how personal struggles impact relationships beyond spy missions.

Sean Combs The Reckoning: Netflix tackles Diddy's rise, rivalries and crimes Netflix is set to release a gripping four-part documentary, Sean Combs: The Reckoning, exploring the rise, influence and controversies surrounding hip-hop legend Sean "Diddy" Combs. Produced by his rival 50 Cent, the series will stream globally from December 2, 2025.

Put Asians in anything: Actor Simu Liu blasts Hollywood's representation gap Simu Liu and several Asian actors have spoken out on social media about the persistent lack of leading roles and meaningful representation for Asian performers in Hollywood, highlighting financial successes and ongoing stereotypes.

Stranger Things 5 Vol 1 review: The past returns and Will finally takes the leadRelease Date:Thu Nov 27, 2025 The end begins. Stranger Things 5 Volume 1 delivers a darker, emotionally charged comeback as past wounds resurface and new threats close in on Hawkins. With tension thick and stakes higher than ever, the four-episode opener is now streaming on Netflix.

Millie Bobby Brown gets emotional ahead of Stranger Things 5 premiere Millie Bobby Brown's heartfelt tribute to Stranger Things and its creators arrives just before the much-anticipated release of Season 5. The series' final chapter promises to deliver intense drama and closure.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 95: Ticket-to-finale task sparks fights, Tanya-Pranit clash 'Bigg Boss 19's latest episode delivered intense drama as contestants clashed during the second phase of the Ticket to Finale task, leading to accusations, heated fights and shifting alliances. Farrhana, Pranit, Gaurav and Ashnoor advanced to the next stage, while tensions among housemates continued to escalate.

Big B gives voice to 26/11 tribute film, video premieres at Global Peace Honours Amitabh Bachchan has narrated a powerful short film paying tribute to the victims and heroes of the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, unveiled by Amruta Fadnavis on the tragedy's 17th anniversary. Several Bollywood celebrities, including Akshay Kumar, Isha Koppikar and Zoya Akhtar, also honoured the martyrs with emotional messages.

Dhanush shares serene Varanasi pics with Kriti Sanon ahead of Tere Ishk Mein release Dhanush shared a heartfelt moment from Tere Ishk Mein promotions in Varanasi, posting joyful photos with Kriti Sanon and director Aanand L Rai. The devotional note and warm camaraderie come as the film's advance bookings soar ahead of its 2025 release.

Palash Muchhal discharged after health scare, wedding to Mandhana remains postponed Palaash Muchhal has been discharged from the hospital. He was admitted following stress-related complications that arose after his wedding to Smriti Mandhana was put on hold.

Vin Diesel praises Dwayne Johnson's The Smashing Machine, hints at end of feud Vin Diesel ended his feud with Dwayne Johnson, praising the actor's commitment to the 'Fast' franchise and celebrating his moving performance in 'The Smashing Machine' (2025) while sharing personal anecdotes about their dynamic pairing.

Who is Rahmanullah Lakanwal, suspect who shot 2 National Guards near White House?Multiple law enforcement sources have identified the suspect as Rahmanullah Lakanwal, a 29-year-old Afghan national who entered the United States in 2021.

How Rajendra Panchal's old fused-jaw photos expose anti-India hate in USSeveral American X accounts recently used Rajendra Panchal's old photos to post racist content targeting Indians, calling them job-stealers. Panchal lived on a liquid diet for 38 years as his parents couldn't afford jaw surgery. Mocking his tragedy is the latest example of the anti-Indian hate in America that has surged under Trump.

US's big move against Afghan nationals after shooting near White HouseThe US has indefinitely halted all immigration requests for Afghan nationals, hours after two National Guard troops were shot near the White House in Washington DC.

Video: Car bursts into flames after crash in Mumbai, occupants miraculously escapeAccording to initial reports, there were three to four people in the car at the time of the accident on Wednesday night and the vehicle was reportedly moving at considerable speed, which contributed to it going out of control and colliding with the divider.

sports.headline: Just before T20 World Cup 2026, Sri Lanka considering Asalanka captaincy sack Sri Lanka selectors are considering sacking Charith Asalanka as the captain of the T20I side, just a few months ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026. Asalanka has struggled for form and left for home ahead of the tri-series in Pakistan.

Indian pitches rated satisfactory, but Perth's 2-day Ashes opener rated very good The ICC has rated the Perth Stadium pitch as "very good" despite the Ashes opener finishing inside two days, a verdict that contrasts sharply with the "satisfactory" ratings handed to recent Test surfaces in India.

Arne Slot responds to sack speculation after Liverpool's worst run in 70 years Arne Slot said it was understandable that questions were being asked over his future as Liverpool head coach, but insisted he still retained the support of the club's hierarchy after another heavy defeat, this time a 4-1 loss to PSV Eindhoven at Anfield.

The Indian team were blanked by South Africa by a margin of 408 runs as the batters struggled to handle Simon Harmer and others.

Mbappe hits four as Real Madrid edge past Olympiacos, Liverpool humbled again Kylian Mbappé made Champions League history with four goals as Real Madrid edged Olympiacos 4-3 in Greece, while Liverpool suffered their first group-stage home loss in 14 matches after a 4-1 defeat to PSV.

WPL 2026 auction complete guide: Where to watch, FAQs and top players on list The Women's Premier League 2026 auction is scheduled for November 27 in New Delhi. The event will feature 277 players and introduce RTM cards, impacting team strategies and player selections.

Is Temba Bavuma the greatest Test captain in his era? IND vs SA: Temba Bavuma ended South Africa's long wait for winning a Test series on Indian soil after their 408-run triumph in Guwahati. Bavuma is unbeaten as Test captain, having won 11 games since 2023.

Worst airline: Siraj hits out at Air India Express after hours-long flight delay Mohammed Siraj publicly called out Air India Express for the 4-hour delay in departure from Guwahati to Hyderabad and the lack of communication regarding it.

Haryana's Sporting Tragedy: National Player Dies After Rusted Pole Collapses in Rohtak This special report covers the death of 16-year-old national-level basketball player Hardik Rathi in Lakhan Majra, Rohtak, after a corroded basketball pole fell on him during practice. The incident highlights the dilapidated state of sports infrastructure and alleged administrative negligence in Haryana, drawing attention to a similar death of another young player in Bahadurgarh just days prior. A person at the scene stated, 'No one has come to us from the sports department'. The report shows the hazardous conditions, including a crumbling gym building, where athletes train, raising questions about player safety and the accountability of the Haryana Sports Department. Locals claim complaints about the dangerous equipment were made to the administration previously without any action being taken.

Poor preparation, tough scheduling hurt India's Test game, says Sunil Gavaskar Former India cricketer, Sunil Gavaskar, in an exclusive interview with Rajdeep Sardesai on India Today opened up on how the packed cricketing calendar for the Indian team may have hampered their preparations when playing Test cricket at home.

Players have to deliver: Sunil Gavaskar hits out at Gautam Gambhir's critics In an exclusive interview with India Today, Sunil Gavaskar defended Gautam Gambhir amid rising calls for his removal, arguing that critics were silent when India won major tournaments under him.

He added that the 0-3 loss to New Zealand last year was a bigger setback.

Gill makes rallying call after Test drubbing: It's the storm that forges steady handsShubman Gill issued a rallying message after India's 408-run loss to South Africa, urging belief and unity as the team looks to recover from a 2–0 home whitewash.

Cheteshwar Pujara's brother-in-law Jeet Pabari dies by suicideJeet Pabari, brother-in-law of former India cricketer Cheteshwar Pujara, died by suicide at his Rajkot home on Wednesday. Police have begun an investigation and are awaiting statements from family members.

From WTC finalists to home punching bags: How India fell from grace in TestsFrom dominating visiting sides to being overpowered on their own pitches, India's Test decline has been as swift as it is shocking. With roles unclear and identity uncertain, the once-formidable home fortress has become just another venue.

12 mahine me do baar: India's home Test problem is of their own makingThe Indian cricket team has lost their second home Test series under the coaching of Gautam Gambhir. Last year it was 12 saal me ek baar. But now under Gambhir's coaching, is this going to become the new normal?

India to be top 5 sporting nation by 2047: Sports Minister after CWG 2030 nodSports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya says India will become a top-five sporting nation by 2047, reacting to the confirmation of Ahmedabad as host of the 2030 Commonwealth Games.

Looking forward to welcoming the world: PM Modi reacts to India hosting CWG 2030India has officially won the bid to host the Centenary Commonwealth Games in 2030. This historic event marks a significant milestone for Indian sports and international camaraderie.

Teams were scared when touring India, now must be licking their lips: Dinesh KarthikDinesh Karthik says India has lost their aura when playing at home, after a second Test whitewash in 12 months, urging clarity, stability and tougher decisions to fix the team's red-ball decline.

It's Official: Ahmedabad To Host 2030 Commonwealth Games After India's Successful BidThis news bulletin reports on the official confirmation that Ahmedabad, India, will host the 2030 Commonwealth Games in October 2030. The report notes that the decision was finalized after a successful campaign by India, with the Indian Olympic Association delegation present at a board meeting in Glasgow where the decision was made. The bulletin highlights this as a significant moment for the country, which previously hosted the games in 2010. A reporter on the ground clarifies that while hosting was previously recommended, the official announcement has now been made, with the bulletin stating, 'the Commonwealth Games will be held in Ahmedabad in Gujarat'.

India need a specialist red-ball coach: DC co-owner wants Gautam Gautam to be axedDelhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal has urged the BCCI to appoint a specialist coach for India's Test side after a 2-0 series loss to South Africa exposed the team's red-ball weaknesses under Gautam Gambhir.

Ahmedabad announced as official host city of Commonwealth Games 2030India were announced as the hosts for the Commonwealth Games 2030. Ahmedabad is set to host the competition. The centenary edition is set to feature between 15-17 sports disciplines.

Death of Haryana basketball players not accident, but negligence: Vinesh PhogatVeteran wrestler Vinesh Phogat condemned administrative negligence after two teenage basketball players died in Haryana within 48 hours, prompting the suspension of Rohtak's sports officer and a statewide safety review.

Gautam Gambhir hay hay: Fans let it rip after India's horror-show in GuwahatiGautam Gambhir was given no mercy by the fans after their shocking defeat to South Africa in Guwahati which resulted in a second whitewash on home soil in his coaching tenure.

Alyssa Healy can't be overlooked, DC likely to eye her in auction: Anjum ChopraFormer Indian batter Anjum Chopra suggested that the Delhi Capitals may target Alyssa Healy for the wicketkeeping and leadership role in the upcoming WPL auction to be held in New Delhi on November 27.

IND v SA: Gautam Gambhir slammed for embarrassing obsession with all-roundersIndia's head coach, Gautam Gambhir, faced the heat from former cricketers for his obsession with all-rounders as India succumbed to a second Test whitewash on home turf under his tenure.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
